revised_title: Insect Competition and Population Growth: A Study of Tribolium, Oryzaephilus, and Rhizopertha
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the growth of insect populations of Tribolium confusum, Oryzaephilus surinamensis, and Rhizopertha dominica in different media. They found that Tribolium had an advantage in competition with Oryzaephilus due to its greater voracity. The results support the idea that species with similar needs and habits cannot survive together, while those with different needs or habits can. The study also showed that the equilibrium between competing species is independent of their initial densities.
